title: Ticket #5001: Automatically update proxy expiration attribute on renewal
description:
Right now, when we update the proxy associated with a job in queue, it is a two step process:
  1. Update the remote proxy (using the Schedd::refreshGSIProxy python binding).
  2. Edit the job's classad to reflect the new value of the x509userproxyexpiration attribute.

Because this is two separate API calls, the process is not atomic. Further, it is a "gotcha" to using the refreshGSIProxy method - naively, a caller would assume all related attributes are updated too.

Can ClassAd update be done schedd side along with the proxy update?
remarks:
2015-Apr-13 08:02:19 by bbockelm:
Code to reference:

https://github.com/dmwm/CRABServer/blob/master/src/python/TaskWorker/Actions/Recurring/RenewRemoteProxies.py#L101

2015-Apr-13 11:03:02 by jfrey:
Yes, we should make this change. It should be easy.

2015-Apr-13 17:34:32 by jfrey:
Should we also update the x509UserProxyExpiration attribute when the proxy file on disk has been updated (i.e. local submission and the user updates the file in place)?

2015-Apr-13 19:43:11 by bbockelm:
Qualitatively, the patch looks fine to me (did not test).

In terms of having HTCondor pick up updates automatically - is that easy? I thought we didn't have the code infrastructure to do this right now...

2015-Apr-14 09:40:54 by jfrey:
The shadow and gridmanager check periodically for a renewed proxy, and could push an update of the expiration time to the schedd. Otherwise, there's no check. I'm leery of automatically updating the expiration time in only some situations.

2015-Apr-14 09:48:44 by bbockelm:
Sounds good. I would also prefer to have the expiration time always updated (I was just curious about implementation costs).

2015-Apr-29 15:20:21 by bbockelm:
Per phone call -

Jaime will commit this patch and do any other simple cases before 8.3.6 release.

Any remaining work items will be bumped to a separate ticket.
